thread.title: What you may have missed: Reaction to the good, the bad and the ugly from the Utah-Arizona State game
thread.title_full: What you may have missed: Reaction to the good, the bad and the ugly from the Utah-Arizona State game

title: What you may have missed: Reaction to the good, the bad and the ugly from the Utah-Arizona State game
text:
Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum, Los Angeles Oct. 24, 5:30 p.m. 5 Days 5 Hrs 14 Mins 56 Secs 
As the third-ranked University of Utah football team was fighting its way to a 34-18 win over Arizona State on Saturday night to remain undefeated, Twitter users were responding to all the good, the bad and the ugly that was happening on the field. 
The top five social media “storylines” from the game: 
Will Utes play BYU in bowl game? Talk of making a run at the national championship in large part overshadowed the fact that Kyle Whittingham’s club became bowl eligible on Saturday, grabbing its all-important sixth victory of the season. 
Of course this would be one fan’s reaction: In fact, Utah could not bother showing up for the next 6 games & the worst that could possibly happen is playing BYU in the Vegas bowl. LOL — Dan Sorensen (@DSorensen) October 18, 2015 
2. Britain Covey debacle: Unfortunately for Utah, the most talked about moment of the game on Twitter was Britain Covey’s “pass” in the end zone on a kickoff that resulted in a safety for Arizona State during the third quarter. 
A sampling of some of the comments made nationwide: This is NOT how to football: http://t.co/v1DCdKPmFL pic.twitter.com/Q83SFDVxLU — SB Nation (@SBNation) October 18, 2015 Dumbest thing I have ever seen.... — Charles Barnard (@ccb1212) October 18, 2015 Just when you thought this day couldn't get weirder. — Stewart Mandel (@slmandel) October 18, 2015 Hahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha — The Blue Brethren (@BlueBrethren) October 18, 2015 Since when is this the signal for a safety? I'm oddly intrigued by this ref now. Dude is chill pic.twitter.com/EPbKmWrzuS — Dan Wetzel (@DanWetzel) October 18, 2015 Just shy of a year ago, btw: pic.twitter.com/rB3uRA85U2 — YEAH CLICK CLACK (@edsbs) October 18, 2015 
3. Chase Hansen sees time at safety: Few players have caught the excitement of Utah fans more than freshman quarterback Chase Hansen, and he made an appearance on Saturday night on defense. 
Hansen saw a few snaps at safety, a move Whittingham later said he made to help improve the depth there after Andre Godfrey got injured. 
The freshman’s appearance on the field certainly got the Twitterverse’s attention: Great did we move Chase Hansen to safety, Whit hates the feeling of having a QB? — Hypothetically Awful (@MACtheSPORK) October 18, 2015 Chase Hansen to defense? I can't. .. I mean... I just.... Wilson better stay healthy and we'd better win this year. Just... wow — ASSU Bum Freckles (@PortlandUte) October 18, 2015 CHASE HANSEN! — Brittany G (@Fibby1123) October 18, 2015 Chase Hansen is an unreal athlete. NFL athlete. If he sticks at safety he'll play a weddle role. QB and Safety snaps throughout game — Jake murphy (@Jake_Murphy82) October 18, 2015 
4. Did Whittingham try to ice Phillips?: With Utah ahead 24-18 and less than five minutes left in the contest, kicker Andy Phillips lined up for a 35-yard field goal attempt. Make it, and it’s a two-possession game. Miss, and the Sun Devils could win with a touchdown. 
Phillips appeared ready to kick, but then Whittingham called a timeout. Ute fans were not happy: Did Kyle just ice Semi-automatic Andy?
